_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 (1998 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Detroit Fire Department and  Wayne County Homeland Security/Emergency Management, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. The primary hospital response is provided through Henry Ford Hospital (and Trauma Center). The Facility is not currently designated a "responding" facility, however, the Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal is a refined product storage and distribution Terminal. The Risk Management Plan covers the butane blending system including one truck offloading station, one horizontal storage vessel, one liquid pump, and associated piping.



Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Detroit Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3). Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor- Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the butane blending system resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Detroit Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Detroit Fire Department and request their assistance. The Facility'

s Facility Response Plan is coordinated with the Detroit Fire Department and the Wayne County LEPC. The Detroit Fire Department is aware of the Facility's butane blending system, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety. Also, Buckeye makes every effort to coordinate annually at minimum with the local responders.
